result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. LEHMAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

supervisions.notes: Conditional Release Plan for a period of twelve (12) months.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jesse J. LEHMAN

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: All records scanned and verified.

Order of Discharge Upon Expiration of Comitment.
Cover letter.
Letter from Patrick Woodbridge to Judge Rohrer.

Order for Placement.
The Court Orders placement is conditional release subject to the plan approved by the Court.

CONDITIONAL RELEASE PLAN HEARING - 
The Court and the parties have all reviewed the Conditional Release Plan.
The defendant is in agreement with all the terms of the plan and waives his right to a hearing on this matter.
The parties agree the length of the commitment is for twelve (12) months.
The Court has a colloquy with the defendant.
The Court committed the defendant to the Department of Health Services on 05-12-15 and approves the Conditional Release Plan.
Minutes.

Conditional Release Plan.
(LOCATED IN 14 CF 425)
Cover Letter.
Order for Placement.

Count 3 - Disorderly conduct - No contest plea.  Convicted.  State moves to dismiss and read in count 1, battery to law enforcement officer and count 2, resist officer.  Motion granted.  Court finds the defendant is not guilty by mental disease or defect.  Court orders a conditional release because it would not pose a risk to others.  Defendant is committed to the Department of Health Services and they are directed to prepare a plan and treatment for release into the community.  Sentencing hearing is set for 06-08-15 at 3:30 p.m.   
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights.  
Minutes.
Plea date set for 05-12-15 at 8:30 a.m.
Hearing scheduled from 3:30 p.m. to 1:30 p.m. on 04-15-15 in BR-1.

of L.W. Cole, M.A., Licensed Psychologist, dated 03-23-2015.
(See 14CF425 for confidential report)
Competency Hearing scheduled for 04-15-2015 @ 3:30 p.m. BR-1.
Order for Examination under 971.16.

Defense counsel changes defendant's pleas to not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect and requests a competency evaluation.  Court grants the motion for examination.  
Minutes.
Status conference is set for 02-25-15 at 3:00 p.m.
Defendant's Notice of Motion; Defendant's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty pleas.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 12-12-14 at 2:00 p.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 11-05-14 at 1:45 p.m.   
Minutes.
Jewel Scharenbroch, Public Defender.
RE:  Officer Justin Massart, on 09-30-14.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of battery to law enforcement officer, disorderly conduct and obstruct officer.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-27-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,500.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no possession of anything that would qualify as a dangerous weapon.   Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination.
Minutes.
